sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Ha 22 Maars, Associated Press matini: "Yimɓe ɗuɗɗum je mari mandolji be jarfuye lekkitajo ndeni njaamɗe mala balɗe ngam lartol." Ha ɓawo aranool mayde ha Lesɗe America matinama ha Washington ha 29 Feviriye, Ngomna Jay Inslee matini jaawal jam ɓaandu, ko je lesɗe feere tokkiti seeɗa ha ɓawo man.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Jaangirdeji ha wakkere Seattle darni jaangirdeji ha 3 Maars, e gal cakkare Maars, jaangirdeji ha nder lesdi ɗon no maɓɓa damuɗe maɓɓe. Ha 6 Maars, Lesɗe America feelama ngam ko footi salla be koronaviriis je keese ha do lesdi gal geeɓe aandoɓe irin nyau ndu ha Imperial College London.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Ha nder balɗe man Jagorɗo Trump wurtini Umrore Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, je wurtini miliarji 8.3$ ha nder siggorde wallende jaawal ngam cuuɗi lesdi ngam jabbinugo do nyau ndu.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Cuuɗi kuɗe wurtini ustol jaahangal ngam huwooɓe maɓɓe, darni kawtirolji, e sembintini huwooɓe ngam huwugo diga saare.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Kuɗe espor be fiijirdeji darnotto. Ha 11 Maars, Trump matini ustol jaahangal ngam ɓurna lesɗe Erop, sna Lesɗe Inglisiya, nder balɗe 30, diga 13 Maars.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Ha nyalade je tokkiti, o yajjini ustolji ndu ha Lesɗe Inglisiya be Ireland bo'o.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Ha 13 Maars, o matini jaawal lesdi, je waɗi ɓe wurtini ceede ha siggorde wallende ngam jabbugo do nyau ndu.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Fuɗɗam ha 15 Maars, cuuɗi fillu jur maɓɓi mala usti ndjamɗe ha do Lesɗe America ngam foondol ustugo yajjol viriis.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Gal 17 Maars, nyau man matinama ha nder lesɗe 50 e ha nder dirstrik Columbia bo'o. Ha 23 Maars, matinama yo'o New York City mari nyauɓe 10 700 ngam koronaviriis, ɓuri limtol nyauɓe fu je ɗon hawti ha South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Ha 5 Maars, ngomna wi'i dayugo ummatore ɗon naffa, nde limggal nyauɓe je ɗon no ɓesda jippi diga balɗe 2.0 ha 4.7.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Diga 28 Maars, wodi nyauɓe 32 308 je ɗon aandi mari nyau ha New York City, be yimɓe 672 maynama ngam virris. Ha 26 Maars, Lesɗe America matinama bana ɓuri marugo nyauɓe koronaviriis je ɗon aandi do kala lesdi feere ha nder duniyaru, bana Cayna be Italy. Diga 8 Aviril, nyauɓe 400 335 lartama bana mari nyau ha Lesɗe America, be 12 841 maynama.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Bana kubaruji matini ha 30 Maars, Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Trump hasdi ngam ɓesdugo dabareji dayol ummatore ha 30 Aviiril.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Ha nder ɓalɗe ndu, USNS Comfort, suudu lekki bana kombeewal be leesoji 1000, dari ha New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Ha 3 Aviirl, Lesɗe America ɗon no limta mayɓe 884 ngam koronaviriis ha nder ndjamdi 24.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Ha nder lesdi New York limgal nyauɓe ɓuri 100 000 ha 3 Aviiril. White House tawama bana ɗon lasbina nyau ndu e ɗon ayna ngewteji gal ɗowugo arduɓe jam ɓaandu be aandoɓe ngam fadugo ngewteji ummatore be sappinolji je larni viriis be ɗowirɗe ɗiɗaɓool Arduɗo Mike Pence.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Dabareji Trump fu ngam aynol nyau ndu lati bana yimɓe ɗon hocca ɗum feere-feere.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Arduɓe be ngewtoɓe Lesɗe America feere lasbini tammunde Lesɗe America do kujeji je maray daraja ha yaasi, bana lekki arandere , ha Cayna.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Lartol feere do fuffugo hendu hoocama ngam didugo e larugo noy yajjol ngu e wurtama ha nder Journal of Travel Medicine  ha cakkare lewru Zaanviye 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Do matinolji 2018 ha Internation Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, beTaipei ɗon no mari yimɓe je waɗatta jaahangal diga Wuhan ɗuɗɗum.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Dubai, Sydney, be Melbourne matinama bo'o bana wakkere je yimɓe ummi Wuhan ɗon njaha no bo'o.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bali matinama bana je lessi aandugo bana wakkere jaahangal ha kunde berniji 20 je ɓuri waɗɗugo jaahangal ko larni taskaram, ha wakati feere bo'o berniji ha Australia ɓuri taskugo. Australia wurtini Jaahargal Jabbuye do Koronaviriis Keese (COVID-19) ha 7 Feviriye.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Holli ɗuɗɗum tawakka tawon do COVID-19, e bo'o Australia sey ɓesda aynol keerol be ngewte ha nder jabbuye mako do nyau.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Ha 21 Maars, jaawal do jaam ɓaandu matinama ha Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Ngam wattugo yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal be dabare hortol ummatore ha Wuhan be Hubei, lesɗe ɗuɗɗum ngaɗi jaahargal wurtinugo yimɓe lesdi maɓɓe be geeɓe fadol maɓɓe ha nder wakkere ndu, aranool gal pireewol je lesdi maɓɓe ɗon hasdi ngam man, be wallende ngomna Cayna.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Canada, Lesɗe America, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, Faransa, Argentina, Jaamani, be Thailand woni ha cakka arandere ɓe'en je waɗi jaahargal wurtinugoo ummatore maɓɓe.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: Pakistan wi'i yo'o o wurtinatta ummatore maɓɓe sam ha Cayna.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Ha 7 Feviriye, Brazil wurtini Braziliya'en mala yeeyaɓe saare 34 ha ɓesdugo Poleji nay, goɗɗo Cayna gooto, be jeeyaɗo Cayna gooto.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Jeeyaɓe Poland, Cayna, be India jippi ha Polan, ha ton pireewol Brazil joɗɗi hiddeko tokkugo lawol maɗa ha Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Ummatore Brazil je yahi ha Wuhan jo'inama ha seera ha wakkere jonde soje'en gal Brasilia.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ha nder balɗe ndu, yimɓe Kanada 215 (176 ha nder aranool pireewol, be 39 ha nder ɗiɗaɓool pireewol je ngomna Lesɗe America taskitti) wurti Wuhan ha CFB Trenton heɓɓa ɓe jo'ina ɓe ha seera nder asawaji ɗiɗi.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Ha 11 Feviriye, wodi pireewol feere je roondi ummatore Kanada 185 diga Wuhan jippi ha CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Ngomna Australia wurtini ummatore mako 277 ha 3 be 4 Feviriye ha Wekkere JJo'inol Christmas Island, je lartini ɗum bana wakkere wondugo seera, e ɓe woni ton nder balɗe 14.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Pireewol hortol New Zealand yotti ha Auckland ha 5 Feviriye; salloɓe (be ɓe'en feere je wurti Australia be Pacific) ngel jo'inama ha seera ha wakkere soje ndiyam Whangaparoa, woila Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Ha 15 Feviriye, Lesɗe America matini yo'o o wartiran ummatore America be kombeewal Diamond Princess.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Ha 21 Feviriye, pireewol feere je roondata ummatore Kanada 129 je wurti kombeewol Diamond Princess jippi ha Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Ha fuɗɗam Maars, ngomna India fuɗɗu wartiirugo ummatore mako diga Iran. Ha 14 Maars pireewol South African Airways feere je Ngomna lesdi South Afirika taski wartiri ummatoore South Afirika 112.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Lartolj jam ɓaandu waɗɗotto hiddeko hortol, be yimɓe South Afirika nay je ɗon no sappina mandolji koronaviriis joɗɗi ha ɓawo ngam ustugo nyau ndu.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Sna ummatore South Afirika je lartama bana maray nyau on wartiri lesdi maɓɓe.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Sappinol lartolji holli ummatore South Afirika fu, be geeɓe pireewol, lanyoowo, geeɓe hotel, polis be soje'en je ɗon no huwida ngam ummatore je, bana dabare hakkika, joɗɗi do aynol e ɗon wondi ha seera ha nder wakati balɗe 14 ha Ranch Resort.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Ha 20 Maars, Lesɗe America fuɗɗi wartirugo geeɓeji soje'en maɗa diga Iraq ngam nyau ndu.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Ha 5 Feviriye, ɗowirɗe Cayna do hoɗɓe matini yo'o lesɗe 21 (bana Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad be Tobago, Egypt, be Iran) neldi wallende ha Cayna.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Jaangoɓe Cayna feere ha nder jam'iareji America mofti ngam neldugo wallende ha wakkereji Cayna je viriis memmi, be geeɓe feere ha Wakkere Chicago je maugel je haɓdi ngam nellugo leepolji suddugo yeeso N95 50 000 ha cuuɗi lekki ha lamrorde Hubei ha 30 Zaanviye. Geeɓe wallende ummatore Direct Relief, be huwidol be FedEx, neldi leepolji suddugo yeeso 200 000 be kujeji fadol feere, bana kujeji suddugo juɗe be ngapaleewolji, gal pireewol jaawal ha Wuhan Union Hospital ha 30 Zaanviye.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Ha 5 Feviriye, Bill be Melinda Gates matini wallende be milionji 100$ ha WHO ngam teffugo baatal be dabare hurgolji be aynugo "ummatore Afirika be South Asia je footi raɓɓa ndu".

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: Interaksyon matini yo'o ngomna Cayna hokki leepolji suddugo yeeso 200 000 Filipia'en ha 6 Feviriye, ha ɓawo Senator Richard Gordon neldi leepolji suddugo yeeso milionji 3.16 ha Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Ha 19 Feviriye, Singapore Red Cross matini yo'o o neldan milionji 2.26$ bana wallende ha Cayna.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: Japan hokki leepolji suudugo yeeso ha Wuhan, Turki sendi ordoji jam ɓaandu, Russiya neldi lekki e kujeji jam ɓaandu ɓuri tonji 13 ha Wuhan, Malaysia matini hokkugo kujeji suddugo juɗe milionji 18 ha Cayna, Jaamani neldi kujeji jam ɓaandu feere-feere be ngapaleewol Hazmat 10 000, e Lesɗe America hokki lekki e kujeji jam ɓaandu tonji 17.8 ha Cayna e waɗi allaama ɓesdugo milionji 100$ bana wallende be ceede ha lesɗe je ɗon memmi. Ha ɓawo nyauɓe ha Cayna bana usti, lesdi ndu fuɗɗi neldugo mballol ha lesɗe feere je nyau ndu ɗon torra.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Ha Maars, Cayna, Kuba be Russiya neldi kujeji jam ɓaandu be lekkitaɓe ngam wallugo Italy nder haɓre be nyau koronavirus ndu.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: Diskudo Jack Ma neldi ordoji lartol milionre 1.1, leepolji sudugo yeeso milionji 6, be ngapaleewol suddugo 60,000 ha Addis Ababa, Etiopia ngam sendinugo gal Kawtirde Lesɗe Afirika.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Ha ɓawo man o neldi kujeji lartol 5 000, leepolji suddugo yeeso 100 000 be ordo fartugo hendu 5 ha Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: Ma bo'o caahi Kanada be kujeji jam ɓaandu. Netherlands, Spain, Turki, Georgiya, be Czech Republic hollini larula maɓɓe do leepolji suddugo yeeso je ngaɗama ha Cayna be kujeji lartol.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Bana sappinol, Spain wurtini kujeji lartol je ngaɗama ha Cayna 58 000 je ɗon sappina goongakku 30%, ha yakke feere bo'o, Netherlands ewnitti leepolji suddugo giite Cayna 600 000 je ɗon mari ɗaate.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: Belgium ewnitti leepolji suddugo yeeso je footay ɓorna 100 000, ɓawo ɓe tawi wurti ha Columbia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Ha yakke feere bo'o, wallende Cayna lati jaɓɓama ha wakkereji Latin America be Afirika feere. Ha 2 Aviiril Suddu Siggorde Duniyaru fuɗɗi be kuɗe wallende jaawal ha lesɗe je ɗon tampi.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: WHO feeli dabareji ngomna Cayna nder aynugo e darnugo nyau ndu.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: WHO fammi feeretirol ha kunde nyau SARS 2002-2004, je ɓe hoosi ngomna Cayna bana kamɓe on waɗi be anya e suɗɗini dabareji aynol be darnol, be nyau ndu je ngomna cakkare "ɗon hokka matinolji tum ngam tato yimɓe hultora hiddeko juldeji Duɓɓi Keese Lewru".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Ha 23 Zaanviye, ngam jabbuye ha do hasduye ngomna cakkare ngam jo'inugo haɗɗol to dabareji hortol ha Wuhan, fadoowo WHO Gauden Galea fammi yo'o "wonay feelore je WHO on ngaɗi", lati "mandol kanduɗum hasduye ngam darnugo nyau ndu ha do baabal je ɓuri nyaɗugo" e ewni ndu "wala bana man ha nder tariya jam ɓaandu". Ha 30 Zaanviye, ha ɓawo aandinol sallinol diga neɗɗo ha neɗɗo ha yaasi Cayna be ɓesdol lomtol nyauɓe ha nder lesɗe feere, WHO matini nyau man bana Larula Jaawal Jam Ɓaandu Duniyaru fu (PHEIC), joowey e aranool PHEIC diga dabare nde ewnama ha yakke nyau ndamba gaduru 2009.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: Arɗuɗo Aranool WHO Tedros Adhanom wi'i PHEIC woni ngam "footi sankitta ha nder duniyaru fu, ɓurna fu ha lesɗe je njaudi maɓɓe ɗon seeɗa be deydey je maray dabareji jam ɓaandu je ɗon kanduɗum.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Ngam jabbuye ha do ustol jaahangalji, Tedros wi'i yo'o "wala uja ha dabareji je ɗon sakla jaahangalji ha lesɗe feere be fillu" be yo'o "WHO feelay ustugo fillu mala wancuru".

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Ha 5 Feviriye, WHO ewni ummatore duniyaru fu ngam dabareji taskugo wallende milionji 675$ ngam lesɗe je maray risku jur, gal ewnugo jaawal wallugo lesɗe je "wala dabareji lartugo yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau, ko to wangi ma".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: Tedros ɓesdi be wi'ugo yo'o "min ɗon mari sembe bana jokke ɓaandu amin je wala sembe" e ewni ummatore duniyaru ngam "nastiina hoore jonta mala yoɓɓita ɓuri ha yeeso". Ha 11 Feviriye, WHO ha kawtirol do kubaruji suɓɓi COVID-19 bana inde nyau ndu.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: Ha nder balɗe nde, Tedros wi'i yo'o Arduɗo Aranool UN António Guterres jaɓɓi hokkugo "sembe siyasa UN fu ha nder jabbuye".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: Geeɓe Dabare do Nyau UN feere ɗon huwida bana jabbuye, je ɗon fada jabbuye Hawtirde Lesɗe fu, je WHO wi'i hokkan ɓe jarfuye ngam "jabbuye do jam ɓandu ha yakke man bo'o geeɓeji feere foodi waɗa aandal maɓɓe ngam huwidugo ngam ko larni nyau ndu ha nder ummatore fu, be marde amin fu".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Ha 14 Feviriye, Geeɓe Kuɗe je Hawtama be Cayna ummiki ngam hokkugo aandoɓe lesɗe feere be WHO ha lesdi Cayna ngam mballugo ha nder aynol e lartol "nyaɗol be sallinol nyau" ha do lesdi gal kude be hawtirolji be cuuɗi teffolji je daraja e ɗowa ngilli ha yaasi ngam lartugo "jabbuye kuɗe ha wakkere lamordeji be guureji, be berniji e kawuyeji". Ha 25 Feviriye, WHO wi'i yo'o "sey duniyaru waɗa dabareji ngam taskugo do nyau koronaviriis je footi wara," o matini bo'o ha yakke je lati no yaawi tawon ewnugo ndu nyau je duniyaru, lesɗe sey wonda be man fu ha "yaɓɓorde taskaram".

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: Ngam jabbuye ha nyau je ɗon doggina ha Iran, WHO neldi Geeɓe Kuɗe je Hawtama ha ton ngam lartugo ko ɗon salla ha ton. Ha 28 Feviriye, arduɓe WHO wi'i yo'o lartol nyau koronaviriis ha yaɓɓorde duniyaru fu fuɗɗan diga "ɗow" ha "dow masitin", je lati ragare maunugo lartol yahde nyau ndu.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: Mike Ryan, ɗowuwo jaahargalji jaawal jam ɓaandu WHO, matini ha nder ngewte feere yo'o "Ndu lati bana lartol goongakku ha kala ngomna duniyaru fu: En finda.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: Viriis ndu footi wonda do lawol mako e sey on taska," gal waɗugo dabareji heɓɓugo jabbuye je footi waɗa duniyaru lutta "ko lati kalluɗum nder ton".

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ryan ɓesdi bo'o be wi'ugo yo'o matinolji jonta ndu hokkay jarfuye ha arduɓe jam ɓaandu matina nyau duniyaru, be wi'ugo ngewte ndu yiɗi wi'ugo "min ɗon jaɓɓa ɓurna yo'o kala neɗɗo ha nder duniyaru ndu footan be viriis ndu".

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Ha Maars, WHO matini koronaviriis bana nyau duniyaru.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: Arduɗo Aranool wi'i yo'o WHO lati "larnama be sembe gal yaɓɓordeji nyaɗugo be yajjugo nyau, be yaɓɓordeji sirure". WHO footi be lasbinol kanduɗum do ngam ko ɗon lari bana yahay nder suklugo do nyau duniyaru ndu, be ragare matinol bana jaawal jam ɓaandu ummatore be nastinugo viriis ha nder geeɓe nyau duniyaru.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: Lasbinol bo'o larni ewnandu ha Arduɗo Aranol WHO Tedros Adhanom jo'ina batakkewol accugo kugal, je yimɓe 733 000 waɗi juɗe do man ha 6 Aviiril.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Ha 26 Maars 2020, aandoɓe jarfuji neɗɗo UN waɗan sappo do sappo ngewtidi ngam dowitinugo jarfuji ko moy fu ha wakati nyau duniyaru COVID-19 ngu.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: Geeɓe aandoɓewi'i yo'o ko moy fu ɗon larni ngam waɗugo dabare hissugo neɗɗo, e ngomna ɗon mari doongal ngu.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: Geeɓe ndu wurtini yo'o dabareji je wala mala fadol jamm ɓaandu footay wonda bana dabare lasbinugo ummatore feere.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Aandoɓe siftoritti bo'o ko moy fu ɗon mari jarfuye ha jam ɓaandu, be yimɓe je mari nyau diga danyinkki, je wondi nder geeɓeji je wonday jur, ndotti'en, yimɓe je saanji baabal jonde maɓɓe ha nder lesdi, yimɓe je maray suudu, yimɓe je ɗon yeeɗa nder laffere je ɓuri sembe, yimɓe je wondi ha suudu fursina, be teffoɓe fadol be geeɓeji feere je mari haaje wallende ngomna.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: Geeɓeji ngomna duniyaru ɗon haɓda ngam nattinugo saɗirmaji be siggorde ceede e ummatore je nyau COVID-19 wadi.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: Geeɓe Kawtal ngam Yahde Siggorde wangini daaldal hokkugo matinolji fu be wakati do dabareji siyasa ha nder lesɗe duniyaru fu, be nummolji e feeloji fu.

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: Diga siyasaji ngam sembintinugo dabareji jam ɓaandu be siggorde duniyaru ngam yiisugo nder saɗirma wondugo ha saare be ustol waɗɗugo jaahangal, cakkare kuɗe larni Lortol Siyasa Lesdi, e yiɗi wallugo lesɗe ekkita oya ha oya e latinugo fadol jabbuye duniyaru ngam nyau korona viriis koyɗum.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: Ngomna Cayna ɗon lasbini gal Lesɗe America, Jagorɗo Cabinet Office Lesɗe Inglisiya Michael Gove, be Jagorɗo Brazil Jair Bolsonaro son Eduardo Bolsonaro ngam aynol do nyau duniyaru ndu, je fuɗɗi ha lamorde Hubei, ha Cayna.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: Arduɓe lamordeji feere je Communist Party of China (CPC) meedotto ngam ɓe waway aynugo do jo'inol yimɓe ha seera ha Cakkare Cayna, mandol bernde be jabbuye dabare siyasa ngam nyau ndu ha nder wakkereji ngu.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Ngewtooɓe feere tammi yo'o yahde ndu naffam ngam fadugo windowo aranol Communist Party je Cayna Xi Jinping ngam turtol ummatore do nyau koronaviriis.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: Arɗuɓe Cayna feere, bana Zhao Lijan salli aandinol aranool do wangol koronaviriis je fuɗɗi ha Wuhan, do dabare ngewte tufle do COVID-19 je ummi ha Lesɗe America mala Italy.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: Ngomna Lesɗe America Donald Trump ewni koronaviriis bana "viriis Cayna" mala "viriis Wuhan" e mbiy Cayna "wanngini viriis feere je lati jonta bana nyau duniyaru fu", kanjuum bo'o je lasbinooɓe feere lasbini gal wi'ugo lati nyeebol asngol e "ɗon suɗɗina aybe arduɓe ngomna mako nder darnugo nyau".

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: The Daily Beast keɓɓi batakkewol ngomna Lesɗe America je ɗon sappina dabareji ngewte je ummi gal Feelore Jam Lesdi, be dabare man ewnotto "Kujeji fu larni Cayna.

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: En limtinama yo'o sey foonda neldol ngewte ndu ha nder dabare feere, be hawrtirde ngam hubaruji be wondugo ha gite tele."Baabe sippolji bana Politico, Foreign Policy, be Bloomberg holli yo' dabareji Cayna fu ngam neldugo wallende ha lesɗe Cayna lati bana lawol hollittugo ɓaandu maɗa ha nder duniyaru.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: Jagorɗo Siyasa lesdi feere Josep Borrell matini yo'o wodi "dabare wakkare be siyasa je ɗon suɗɗi ha ɓawo man bana kaɓɓol ngam mangu gal suɗɗol be "siyasa wallende".

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
targetString: Borrell wi'i bo'o "Cayna ɗon yarɓa matinol ndu be sembe, na bana Lesɗe America, lati  sobaajo je mari daraja be amana."

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: Cayna ewni bo'o Lesɗe America ngam itta eltaji do Syria, Venezuela be Iran, e bo'o o ɗon nelda wallende ha ragare ɗiɗi je ɗon limti ndu.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
targetString: Wallende Jack Ma be leepol suddugo yeeso 100 000 ha Cuba darnotto ngam eltare Lesɗe Ammerica ha 3 Aviiril.

sourceString: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
targetString: Ngomna Lesɗe America ngullama ngam waylittugo wallende je yarɓi ha lesɗe feere ha nder lesdi maɓɓe.

sourceString: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
targetString: E woodi haalaji feere je matinama do leepol suddugo yeeso ha kunde lesɗe feere, bana Jaamani, Ostriya, Swiss; be Czech Republic be Italy.

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
targetString: Ha ɓesdugo, Turki ngawi ordoji fuffugo hendu temere do temere je neldama ha Spain.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
targetString: Ha fuɗɗam Maars, ngomna Italy lasbini Kawtal Erop ngam wala hakkilo wallende do Italy je koronaviriis ɗon torra.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
targetString: Maurizio Massari, fadowo Italy ha EU, wi'i yo'o "Sna Cayna on jabbi gal wakkere ɗiɗi fu.

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: Be gonga, ndu latay mandol boɗɗe ngam kawtal Erop."

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Ha 22 Maars, ha ɓawo ngewte ha telefon be Arduɗo Aranool Italy Giuseppe Conte, Jagorɗo Russiya Vladimir Putin hasdi be soje'en Russiya ngam neldugo lekki soje'en, mootaji laɓɓinugo je feerejo, be ordoji lekki feere ha Italy.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: Batakkewol hubaruji Italy je mbiyotto La Stampa matini "ɗaaɗol siyasa je mari daraja" amma wala inde yo'o 80% wallende Russiya lati no bana "naffay mala maray naffuda jur ha Italy".

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: Batakkewol ndu ɗon mbi'a yo'o Russiya ɗon nasta nder haɓre "siyasa be joɗɗidol" be lesdi feere.

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
targetString: Jagorɗo Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, be Arduɗo Geeɓe Lesdi feere Luigi Di Maio sallini batakkeji kubaruji e hollini nyetore maɓɓe.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
targetString: Russiya bo'o neldi pireewol addugo kujeji be wallende jam ɓaandu ha ton ha Lesɗe Amerika.

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: Matinoowo Kremlin Dmitry Peskov wi'i yo'o "ha wakati hokkugo wallende ha sobiraaɓe Lesɗe America, [Putin] tammi yo'o to taggooɓe kujeji jam ɓaandu Lesɗe America keɓɓi sembe, ɓe footi lortira ɗum to ɓe mari dabare man."

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: Jaahargal jaangirde soje'en NATO "Defender 2020" ha Jaamani, Poland be lesɗe Baltic, jaangirde koono je ɓuri maunugo NATO diga timminol Koono Peewɗum, ustan seeɗa.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: Arduɗo Aranol Ewnaandu ngam Jippinugo Baandi Kate Hudson lasbini kugal Defender 2020: "ha yakke nyau ummatore fu je jonta ndu, footi memma soje'en je ummi diga Lesɗe America be lesɗe Erop feere je ɗon huwida e bo'o be ummatore lesɗe je jaangirde ndu ɗon salla ha ton. "Ngomna Iran raɓɓotto suusey be viriis, be jeeyaɓe kawtal fadooɓe ummatore ɓuri caappan ɗiɗi je ɗon mari nyau ndu be yimɓe siyasa jonta mala aran sappo e joowey.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
targetString: Jagorɗo lesdi Iran Hassan Rouhani windi batakkewol maɓɓitama ha arduɓe duniyaru na nder ton o ɗon emma wallende ha 14 Maars 2020, gal wi'ugo yo'o lesdi mako ɗon haɓda ngam haɓɓugo be nyau ndu ngam footay o nasta ha do lumoji duniyaru feere ngam eltare je Lesɗe America jo'ini do Iran. Nyau ndu ummini ewnaanduji ha Lesɗe Amerika ngam hoosugo siyasaji gooto je sallata ha nder lesɗe diskuɓe feere, be suklare jam ɓaandu duniyaru, suklare do ɓikkon, siwtare saare je ɗon yoɓɓi, be wallende ngam jam ɓaandu be ceede e dabareji jur.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
targetString: Lartooɓe siyasa aarti be wi'ugo yo'o footi lasbina sa'a suɓɓittol Donald Trump ha suɓɓol Arduɗo 2020. Jonde lesdi ha kunde Japan be South Korea sakkiti ngam nyau ndu.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
targetString: South Korea lasbini "dabareji wattugo seera je ɗon jiɓɓi e je laɓɓay" ha ɓawo Japan matini ko moy fu je ummi diga South Korea sey wonda ha seera nder asawere ɗiɗi ha wakkere je ngomna taski ngam man.

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Ummatore South Korea ɗon no sendi tawon do jabbuye Jagorɗo lesdi Moon Jae-In ngam nyau ndu.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
targetString: Korea'en waɗɗi juɗe maɓɓe do batakkewol ngam jippinugo Moon do ko ɓe mbiyotto ngomna waway aynugo nyau ndu, mala yettugo jabbuye maɗa. Nyau duniyaru ndu waɗi lesɗe sallini umrore jaawal bana jabbuye.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
targetString: Ngewtooɓe feere tammi yo'o footi hokka jarfuye ha ngomna'en ngam sembintinugo sembe maɓɓe nder lamu.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: Ha Hungary, kawtal arduɓe suɓɓi hokkugo jarfuye ha Arduɗo Aranol, Viktor Orbán, ngam sallinugo umrore ndu ha tokkita, darna kawtal arduɓe be suɓɓolji e elta ɓe'en je ɗon aandin sallini matinolji je wonay gonga do viriis be dabare je ngomna waɗɗatta ngam wurtugo nder saɗirma ngu.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: Nyau koronaviriis waɗi  sababuji ɗuɗɗum bana ta'irdeji yite, ngam cuuɗi jam ɓaandu ɗon huwa be yite jur ngam suklugo do nyau ndu ha nder duniyaru, hulol soddugo, darnol cuuɗi tagol kujeji be jaahangal.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: Geeɓe Lesɗe America do Yamɗe be Lekki wurtini matinolji ngam hikkilugo do ta'irdeji lekki be ordoji jam ɓaandu ngam emmolji ɗon jur e taggooɓe usti.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: Wakkereji jur bo'o maati hulol soddugo je ngaɗi kujeji timmi ha nder lumoji manungel bana nyamdu, takkarde gaɗɗa suudu, ndiyam kolooba, je ngaɗi dari yottugo lumo fahin.

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: Dabare teknik ɓurna ɗon no matina do ɗayyol nder neldol kujeji bana ordoji.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: Ha limtol Arduɗo Aranool WHO Tedros Adhanom, emmol ngam kujeji suddugo ɓaandu ɓesdi nder 100.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: Emmol ndu ngaɗi kujeji nyaaɗi nde noggas e waɗi bo'o neldol kujeji bana lekki nder leebi nay ha joowey.

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: Ngaɗi bo'o kujeji suddugo ɓaandu ha nder duniyaru lati caɗɗum tawugo, be WHO ɗon matina yo'o ndu footi memma huwoɓe ngam jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: Ha Australia, nyau duniyaru ndu hokki sa'a ha sippooɓe daigou ngam sippinugo kujeji Australia ha Cayna.

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: Kugal ngel waɗi kujeji ɓikkon pammaron tawatakke ha nder cuuɗi sippol maungel e bo'o darnama gal ngomna Australia. Ko to limtol nyauɓe COVID-19 ha Woila Italy be wakkere Wuhan, be ewnaanduji ngam kujeji nyamɗe ɗuɗɗum, wakkereji ɗiɗi fu maray larulaji ngam nyamdu tawon.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: Dabareji gal Cayna be Italy do moftugo kujeji be fillu kujeji je tawatakke je yahay be lawol ɗon yaha, ko ɗon ayna do ustolji timminol nyamɗe je aarti ha Erop be Woila America.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: Woila Italy be ndemri maɗa je ɗon maungel laray ustol suɗɗol maɗa, amma ceede man ɓesdi ha ngewte fadooɓe.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: Kujeji nyamɗe timmi ha wakati seeɗa tan, ko ha nder berniwol Wuhan, ha wakati ndu arduɓe ngomna Cayna wurtini siggorde kuusel gaduji ngam heɓɓa nyamdu he'a ha ummatore.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: Irin umroji ndu ɗon ha Italy je emmatta ɓe'en je ɗon waɗa kujeji nyamdu ngam jaawal.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: Larula ha siggorde duniyaru matinama ha Cayna: ha limtol batakkewol hubaruji feere ha 16 Maars, siggorde Cayna memmotto masin ha nder aranool leebi ɗiɗi je 2020 ngam dabareji je ngomna hoosi ha darna yajjol viriis, e sippol kujeji pamarron jippo be 20.5%.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: Bana lesdi Cayna woni siggorde maungel e cakkare tagle kujeji, wangol nyau jiɓɓi kujeji jur ha nder yahde siggorde duniyaru fu.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: Agathe Demarais je Economist Intelligence Unit wi'i lumoji jiɓɓan seeɗa hidekko gite lara be boɗɗum ko footi wanga nder ton.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: Ha Zaanviye 2020, lartooɓe feere tammi yo'o ribaji je wurtotto nder nyau ndu do yahde maunugo ɓuran je ko salli be nyau SARS je 2002-2004.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: Aandowo feere wi'i ha Washington University ha St. Louis yo'o ɓuran miliarji 300$ majjan ha nder dabare wurtol nyau ndu e neeɓan ha duɓɓi ɗiɗi..

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) mbiyotto "jiɓɓi" ha ɓawo ceede neebam do'i bana wala naandu man sam ngam Cayna darni soddugo.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: Lumoji duniyaru fu do'i ha 24 Feviriye ngam limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 ha yaasi Cayna ɓesdi jur.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: Ha 27 Feviriye, ngam nummolji je ɗon ɓesda ngam nyau koronaviriis, limgalji lumoji Lesɗe America feere be NASDAQ-100, S&P 500 Index, be Dow Jones Industrial Average yarɓi do'are maɓɓe je ɓuri diga 2007-08.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: Limngalji tati fu timmini asawere be ɓuri 10%

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: Ha 28 Feviriye, Scope Ratings GmbH holli limgal Cayna, amma acci bana Sappinol je Yahay.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: Lumoji jippi fahin ngam hulolji koronaviriis, do'are maungel je wondi ha 16 Maars.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: Yimɓe jur tammi yo'o footi jippol wona.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: Siggoowo Mohamed El-Erian yetti dabareji jaawal cuuɗi siggorde cakkare be lesɗe je yotti be wakati

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: Cuuɗi siggorde cakkare ɗon jabbina law do ko ɓe waɗi ha do'are ceede 2008.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: Ngilli lati wakkere kugal je ɗon memmi masin ngam darnol jaahangal, maɓɓol baabe ummatore be jaahangal ngillugo, be feelore ngomna'en tato goɗɗo waɗa jaahangal ha nder duniyaru.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: Bana ko tokki bo'o, jaahangal be pireewolji ɗuɗɗum darnakke ngam yimɓe ngaɗata jaahangalji, bana British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, be Qantas, ha wakati man bo'o British regional airline Flybe do'i.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: Jaahangla be kombeewol bo'o aandi do'are je meeɗay sallugo sam.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: Baabe hoosugo jirki be ferry maɓɓi dammuɗe maɓɓe.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: Nyau ndu hawti be Chunyun, wakati jaahangal maungel be siwtare Duɓɓi Keese ha Cayna.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: Kujeji ɗuɗɗum be mofturde ummatore jur darnotto gal ngomna lesɗe be wakkerji, be juldeji hittande Duɓɓi Keese, be kawtirde je ɗon maɓɓa cuuɗi be kujeji ngilli hoore maɓɓe bana Hong Kong Disneyland be Shanghai Disneyland.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: Kujeji Duɓɓi Keese Lewru be kujeji ngilli maɓɓakke ngam tato ummatore mofta, be Forbidden City ha Beijin be baabe sappinol cuuɗi deewal wuro.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: Ha nder lamordeji Cayna 24 do 31, berniji be wakkereji, arduɓe yarɓi siwtare Duɓɓi Keese ha 10 Feviriye, e emmi ha baabe jur ta ɓe maɓɓita to wakati man yottay.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: Wakkereji ndu ɗon fadi no 80% GDP lesdi e 90% kuje wurtinugo lesdi.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: Hong Kong ɓesdini jabbuye mako do nyau je raɓɓungel ha je maungel e matini jaawal, maɓɓi jaangirdeji ha Maars, darni juldeji Duɓɓi Keese. Wakkereji sippol pamarron memmotto ha nder duniyaru fu, be ustolji wakati ha nder cuuɗi sippol mala maɓɓol man fu.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: Ngillugo sippooɓe pamarron ha Erop be Latin Americajippi be 40%.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: Sippoɓe pamarron Woila America be Cakkare Funaange jippi be 50-6%

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: Ndu waɗi bo'o wancuru be kosɗe ha nder cuuɗi sippol jippi be 33-43% ha Maars to foondi be Feviriye.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: Arduɓe cuuɗi sippol ha nder duniyaru ɓesdi dabareji feere, bana ɓesdol do aynol jam ɓaandu, jo'inol kuje hoosugo wullam ɓaandu ngam larugo wullol ɓaandu soddooɓe, be darnolji kujeji. United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America tammi yo'o, nyau ndu je waɗi kujeji usti ndu footi acca yimɓe ha kunde milioji 14 be 22 ha nder laffere ha Latin America do ha wakati je wala no nyau duniyaru ndu sam.

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: Ha Zaanviye be Feviriye 2020, ha yakke nyau ha Wuhan wa'i masitin, yimɓe waɗan milionji 5 ha Cayna majjini kugal maɓɓe.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: Huwooɓe Cayna ha kawye je ummi lesdi feere waɗan milionji 300 je ɗon ruffi ha saare tan ha nder lamordeji mala ɗon woni ha nder lamorde Hubei. Ha Maars 2020, ɓuri Amerika'en milionji 5 ha Cayna majjini kugal maɓɓe e ɗon no emma wallende ngomna.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: Nyau koronaviriis footi hoosita kugal milionji 47 ha Lesɗ America e wondugo wala kugal footi yotta 32%, bana Federal Reserve Bank St Louis tammi. Wondugo ha saare ha India itti kugal ha huwooɓe je wari lesdi feere ha India milioji sappo do sappo (je ɓe ɗon yoɓɓotto no ko wetti fu). Emmol ha Angus Reid Institute tawi yo'o 44% caalaje Kanadiya'en matti irin wondugo bila kugal. Ɓadi huwooɓe 900000 majjini kugal maɓɓe ha Spain diga ɓe emmotto wonda ha saare ha cakkare Maars 2020.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: Ha nder diɗaɓre ta'irde Maars, huwooɓe Faraansare milionji 4 emmi wallende hideko ngam ɓe wala no kugal tawon e huwooɓe Inglisiya milionre emmi dabare nyamande fu. Ɓadi reeta milionre cuuɗi tagle ha Jaamani neldi huwooɓe maɓɓe do baalal jaahargal ngomna nder wakati seeɗa je ɗon aandin bana Kurzarbeit.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: Wallende nder kugal ha nder wakati seeɗa Jaamani hoccama bo'o gal Faraansa be lesɗe Inglisiya.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: Wakkereji bana didugo kujeji be juɗe mala tariya wuro memmotto be boɗɗum be nyau ndu, ko ɗon memma bo'o jaahargalji kuɗe be yimɓe fu, ɗiɗi fu huwooɓe je ɓe hoosi be je halal maɓɓe, ha nder duniyaru.

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
targetString: Wakkereji bana didugo kujeji be juɗe mala tariya wuro foondi ummitinugo kuɗe maɓɓe (je ɓurna ngomna on hokkata ceede) ngam maɓɓitnugo suudu tariya wuro ha ummatore, jogga jam huwooɓe maɓɓe be je ummatore, e walla didooɓe to footi waɗa.

sourceString: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
targetString: Ha Maars 2020, ha nder duniyare e be yahde feere-feere, cuuɗi tariya, cuuɗi jaangirde, wakkere sappinol fiijirde, cuuɗi ummatore feere maɓɓi dammuɗe maɓɓe be sappinolji, kuɗe be kugal maɓɓe fu darnama mala yarɓotto.

sourceString: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
targetString: Ha jabbuye dabareji jur ngaɗama ngam keɓɓugo labbi feere gal daaldal ordoji. Wangol feere je nyau ndu wadi law bo'o lati darnol kuɗe deewal, kujeji espor, be kujeji ummatore feere, bana juldeji gimmol be wommugo, kawtirdeji teknik, be sappinol samman.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
targetString: Suudu wurtinugo vidiyo bo'o aandi darnol. Vatikan matini yo'o heɗɗitugo Asawere Seeninde ha Roma, je ɗon salla ha ragare asawere summay ummatore Allah, darnotto fu.

sourceString: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
targetString: Cuuɗi ɗuɗɗum feeli ummatore Allah je ɗon mari duɓɓi wonda ha saare do yahugo ha suudu haykaaliru be Alat; jullurdeji feere ngaɗi deewal gal radiyo, do hawo mala gal tele ha wakati feere bo'o yimɓe feere ɗon ngaɗa ndu nder moota.

sourceString: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
targetString: Suudu Haykaaliru Katolik Roma'en je Roma maɓɓi jullurdeji maɗa be cuuɗi deewal e Baabal St. Peter wala ngilloɓe maasianko'en, yimɓe dina'en feere bo'o darni deewalji e usti kawtirde ummatore ha nder jullurdeji maasianko'en, jullurdeji yimɓe Mohammed, cuuɗi deewal be gurdwaras.

sourceString: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
targetString: Ɗowirɗe Geeɓe Iran matini yo'o darnol tornde Jumɓaare ha nder wakkereji je ɗon memmi be nyau ndu e ha ɓawo man ɓe maɓɓi baabe deewal, ha wakati man Saudi Arabiya darni nastirde ngilloɓe je ummi lesdi feere be je lesdi ndu ha wekkereji seeninde Makka be Medina.

sourceString: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
targetString: Nyau duniyaru darni kujeji ɗuɗɗum ha nder wakkere jaahargal espor ha nder duniyaru diga Koono Maungel Ɗiɗaɓool.

sourceString: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
targetString: Ɓurna kujeji espor darnotto mala yarɓotto, bana 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, wakati NBA 2019–20, be wakati NHL 2019–20 NHL.

sourceString: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
targetString: Nyau darni jaahargalji Summer Olympics 2020, je hasdi no tawon ngam fuɗɗan ha ragare Zwiiye; International Olympic Committee matini ha 24 Maars yo'o kuɗe man "jaahargal ngal ngaɗotto ndu ha gaɗɗa 2020 amma yottata ha cakkare 2021". Casinoji be wakkereji fiijirdeji feere ha nder duniyaru maɓɓakke be caacaa poker yarɓotto mala darnottoo.

sourceString: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
targetString: Ndu waɗi fiijooɓe caacaa eggi do hawo, daadalji fiijirde do hawo jur matini ɓesdare kanduɗum nder limtoji yimɓe je wari. Wakkere fiijirde gal gimmol memmotto, be geeɓeji gimmol je darni mala haɗɗi kuɗe maɓɓe.

sourceString: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
targetString: Theatreji jur bana ɓe'en je ɗon ha Broadway darni kujeji maɓɓe fu.

sourceString: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
targetString: Fiijooɓe feere teffi dabareji feere ngam tokkitugo be waɗugo e sendugo kugal maɓɓe do internati bana lawol feere do fiijugo ha yeeso yimɓe, bana yimmugo ha gite ummatore mala wurtinugo "juldeji" do internati, senda, e sappina kugal maɓɓe.

sourceString: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
targetString: Ha do hawo, memeji internati je ɗon larni koronaviriis ɗuɗɗum yajji e feere en bo'o latini ɗum bana gussa be fiijirde ha cakka saɗirma.

sourceString: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
targetString: Diga nyau COVID-19 fuɗɗi, nyeebol, gaanyol, be suɓɓol asli ɗon wagaare ha kunde yimɓe Cayna be jippooɓe asngol Funaange Asia, e do yimɓe je wurti ha wakkere je nyau man ɗon nyaɗi ha Erop, Lesɗe America be lesɗe feere.

sourceString: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
targetString: Ha nder lesɗe ɗuɗɗum bo'o en ɗon maanda hullol, hakkilol, be gaanyol ɓurna fu ha Erop, Funaange Asia, Woila America, be wakkere Asia-Pacific.

sourceString: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
targetString: Batakkewolji hubaru Feviriye (ha wakati je ɓurna nyauɓe wonditti ha seera ha Cayna) maandi ngewte sakkinolji ha nder geeɓeji feere-feere do ummatore Cayna bana ndika viriis ndu yotti ɓe mala jaɓɓugo ndu bana eltare Allah.

sourceString: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
targetString: Lesɗe feere ha Afirika bo'o sappini hakkilo larugo ummatore Cayna be gite je woɗɗay.

sourceString: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
targetString: Yimɓe Wuhan be Hubei jur matini suɓɓol je yimɓe ngaɗata no ngam asngol maɓɓe.

sourceString: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
targetString: Ummatore Cayna keɓɓi fadol, ɗiɗi fu do hawo je be hunduko fu, be wakkereji je viriis ndu ɗon no nyaɗi.

sourceString: Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.
targetString: Ngam yahde nyau ha lesɗe je lati bana ɓundu nyau ndu, yimɓe diga Italy, aranool lesdi ha Erop je matini nyau COVID-19, footi bo'o lata bana nyebotto mala gaanyotto. Ummatore lesɗe bana Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, be South Korea fuɗɗi no be waɗɗugo juɗe do batakkeji je yiɗi no darnugo nastirde ummatore Cayna ha do lesdi maɓɓe ngam dabare darnugo nyau ndu.

sourceString: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
targetString: Ha Japan, hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan doggi do Twitter.

sourceString: Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
targetString: Ummatore Cayna be Asiya'en feere ha nder lesɗe Inglisiya be Lesɗe America matini ɓesdugo huddi ngam asngol, be saɗirmaji feere.

sourceString: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
targetString: Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Donald Trump lasbinakke ngam o ewni no koronaviriis "viriis Cayna", wolde je lati bana huddi e gaanyo ha gite yimɓe je larti ndu.

sourceString: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
targetString: Ummatore je ɗon turti ha Ukraine darni mootaji je hooratta Ukrainiya'en be yimɓe lesdi feere diga Wuhan ha Novy Sanzhary.

sourceString: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Jaangoɓe je warti Northeast India, je ɗon mari keerol gooto ba Cayna, e je ɗon jaanga ha ɓurna berniji India matinama bana yari bone ngam nyau koronaviriis.

sourceString: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
targetString: Jagorɗo geeɓe Bharatiya Janata Party's State ha West Bengal Dilip Ghosh wi'i yo'o Cayna woni duniyaru e "ngam kanjuum Allah ɗon elta ɓe ngam man".

sourceString: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
targetString: Mandolji ndu lasbinotto gal fadoowo ummatore Cayna ha Kolkata ha ɓawo man, e ewni ɗum "aybe". Ha Cayna, gaanyol be suɓɓol asngol ngam ummatore je wonday yimɓe Cayna ɓesdi be nyau duniyaru ndu, be hoɗɓe ewnama bana "kujeji sakkinugo cuɗɗi" je sey "sakkina".

sourceString: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
targetString: Batakkeji hubaru jur be pawallji itti ɓe ngam matinolji feere'en mala fu do koronaviriis.

sourceString: Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
targetString: Teffooɓe batakkeji hubaru ɗuɗɗum wolwi do nyau je ɗon ndu bila suɗɗugo kuje sam.

sourceString: Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
targetString: Teffoɓe feere suɓɓi sendugo sappinolji maɓɓe lau do ordo hiddeko wurtinol do ɗereji bana bioRxiv.

sourceString: Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
targetString: Nyau je wangi keesum, nyau je ɗon raɓɓa be gilɗi keese, ɓurna keesum nger wangol yahde ngel mala lawo sallinol.

sourceString: Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
targetString: Duniyaru fu be nyau - lartol duniyaru fu be sallinol nyau

sourceString: List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
targetString: Limtol nyau raɓɓol be nyau duniyaru - Limtol mayɓe ngam nyau je raɓɓatta

sourceString: Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
targetString: Daabaji je ɗon suɗɗina be nyau je ɗon salla gal daabaji - Sababuji jam ɓaandu je yahidatta be fillu daabaji je ummi lesdi feere.

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: Lartol nyau pofɗe koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19) ha nder suudu lartol be viriis je yahidatta be SARS-CoV-2 larni dabareji je ɗon maanda wondugo viriis be ɓe'en je ɗon maanda fadooɓe baandu je wurti bana jabbuye ha nyau ndu.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.
targetString: Wondugo viriis ha nder leekuji ɗon aandin gal RT-PCR, je ɗon maanda RNA koronaviriis.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Lartol ndu lati feerejo e ɗon larni RNA viriis SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
targetString: Naffan ngam aandinugo nyauji keese mala je ɗon huwa.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
targetString: Maandol fadooɓe ɓaandu (lartol neebam iyam) footi naffa ɗiɗi fu ngam lartol e aynol ummatore.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
targetString: Lartol fadoowo ɓaandu ɗon sappina yimɓe noy ɗon no mari nyau, bana ɓe'en je mandolji mman ɗuɗɗay no ngam sappinugo mala wangay no sam ma.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
targetString: Limtol mayde nyau je fakatre be wakkere wonde sembe ɓaandu ummatore footi aandotto gal sappinolji lartol ndu.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
targetString: Ngam lartol je wonay jur, ha Maars 2020 wala lesdi je marin no matinolji be amana do limtol viriis ha nder ummatore

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
targetString: Gal 23 Maars, wala lesdi je larti ɓuri 3% ummatore maɗa, e wodi saajolji ɗuɗɗum do lartolji noy salli ha nder lesɗe.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
targetString: Saanjol ndu ɗon memma limtol mayde nyauɓe je ɗon matini jur, je ɓurna fu yimɓe ɗuɗɗini ɗum be hunduko ha nder lesɗe feere.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
targetString: Huwidugo be lartol jaangirde polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓawo footi salla do leekuji pofɗe je keɓɓama gal dabareji feere-feere, be ndamba kine mala leeku daande.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
targetString: Sappinolji ɓurna fu ɗon wurta ha nder njamɗe seeɗa mala nder balɗe 2.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
targetString: Lartol RT-PCR je salli do leekuji daande maran amana ha nder arandere asawere nyau ndu tan.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
targetString: Ha ɓawo man viriis footi majja ha nder daande ha wakati man bo'o ɗon nufta ha nder fuffu.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
targetString: Ha yimɓe je lartama ha nder ɗiɗaɓre asawere, kuje hoosugo leeku feere footi hoccama gal lawol pofɗe gal musinugo be kateeter mala kuje sondugo (ndamba).

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
targetString: Gooto ha cakka lartolji PCR je arandere wurtakke ha Charité ha Berlin ha 20 Zaanviye 2020 gal huwidugo be jaangugo polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓawo be wakati man, e wurtini kujeji 250 000 ngam sendinugo gal Geeɓe Jam Ɓaandu Duniyaru (WHO).

sourceString: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
targetString: Lesɗe Inglisiya wangini dabare lartol ha 23 Zaanviye 2020. Suudu tagle South Korea Kogenebiotech wurtini toɓe suudu lekki, kuje lartol SARS-CoV-2 do PCR (PowerChek Coronavirus) ha 28 Zaanviye 2020.

sourceString: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.
targetString: O ɗon teffa gene "E" je kala beta koronaviriis en ɗon mari, e gene RdRp je feerejo ha SARS-CoV-2. Ha Cayna, BGI Group lati gooto ha cakka aranool cuuɗi teffol ngam jaɓɓugo jarfuye kugal jaawal ha China's National Medical Products Administration ngam kuje lartol SARS-CoV-2 do PCR. Ha nder Lesɗe America, Ɗowirɗeji Aynol e Lartol Nyau (CDC) ɗon senda daaldal Lartol Koronaviriis Keese 2019 (2019-nCoV) RT-PCR be wakati man ha cuuɗi teffol ngomna  gal International Reagent Resource.
