targetString: Aynolji sababu ha wakkere kugal ɗon saanja be wakkere kugal  be irin kugal man, do lartol sababu wondugo, nyaɗugo nyau ha nder ummatore, be kujeji je footi saɗɗina huwooɓe je footi raɓɓa COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) wi'i yo'o, irin kuɗe petpetel maray sababuji jur ngam hoosatta baabe jur be ummatore mala be huwooɓe feere, je dabareji aynol nyau aranool feelama, bana lallugo juɗe, sembintinugo huwooɓe joɗɗa ha saare to ɓe nyauɗo, laɓɓinugo lawol pofɗe, be laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo baabe kugal.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Kuɗe je sababu naangugo nyau deydey larni ɓe'en je ɗon ngida be je on aanda mala bana ɗon roondi nyau COVID-19, amma je footi raɓɓa nyau ndu ngam sallinol ummatore je jonta mala gal jaahangal ha lesdi feere.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Ndu larni huwoɓe je mari dabare footugo be ummatore bana ha jaangirde, wakkere kugal je yimɓe ɗon jur, wakkeriji je kujeji sippitol jur ɗon mofti ha ton.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Aynolji sababu geeɓe ndu, ha ɓesdugo ha dabareji aynol nyau je aranool, wodi hendu gal ordoji je ɗon haɗɗa gilɗiji salla, leepol je suddata ɓislol, be marugo limse fadol hoore mum je ɗon woni to on ɗon ngida be goɗɗo je ɗon mari COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA ɗon limma huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu be huwooɓe do mayɓe bana hoore maɓɓe ɗon sappini mala goɗɗo je footi mara COVID-19 lati bana mari sababu maungel, ko ɗon ɓesdina ha sababu je tuuli to huwooɓe ɗon ngaɗa laahalji je ɗon wurtina aerosol do, malla ɗon mofta, mala ɗon memma lekkuji, goɗɗo je ɗon mari mala je footi mara COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Aynolji sababu je kanduɗum ngam irin huwooɓe ngu larni aynolji injiiniya'en bana cuuɗi je hendu ɗo boɗɗe, be kujeji sudol je ɗon yahida be kugal ngel.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Nyauji COVID-19 footi mara sababuji jur ha nder wakkere kugal.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Huwooɓe footi wondatta ha kugal ngam ɓe raɓɓi nyau, ngam ɓe yiɗi suklugo do yimɓe feere, mala ngam hulol naangugo nyau.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Sappinolji fillu footi saanja, ɗiɗi fu do ko larni kujeji je ɓe ɗon emma, be dabareji keɓɓugo kujeji ndu (bana soddugo ha wakati je kuje saɗɗay jur, mala gal yimɓe je wartirata ndu ha saare mala ha sallooɓe be moota.

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Ha timminol, yarɓol kujeji diga wakkereji je COVID-19 ɗon memma be sembe footi darnotto. Jaahargal taskaram mala jabbuye ngam nyau footi naffa ngam fadugo kuɗe.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Jaahargalji ɗon usta yahdeji sababu je yahidatta be wakkereji kugal fu be irin kuɗe man, bana hoore je ɗon sappini, kujeji je footi ɓesda sababuji ha saare ha cakka ummatore, be kujeji je footi ɓesda sababuji yimɓe je huwatta feere maɓɓe bana newugo mala nyau feere je ɗon tokkita.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Ɓe wurtini bo'o aynolji ngam ustugo irin sababuji, be jaahargalji wattugo ha seera ngam ko footi ummina bana sappinol nyauji.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Taskaram be jaahargalji jabbuye ngam nyau je ɗon raɓɓa footi nasta nder feeloji lesdi mala lammorde.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Dabareji ngam jabbuye ha nyau ndu larni aynol sallinol ha huwooɓe, yimɓe je ɗon sukla do yimɓe feere je ɗon mari sababuji ngam nyaɗugo nyauji feere, tokkitindirol fillu, be ustugo sababuji feere ha wakkere feere ha nder yahde maɓɓe.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Nyaɗugo nyau ha nder ummatore je fillu ɗon wondi ɗon memma dabareji je hoosama.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Yaɓɓordeji aynol sababuji lati dabare je ɗon huwida ha wakkereji jam e jam ɓaandu ngam wurtinugo aynolji be geeɓe man e be naffuda man.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Ha wakkere je footay itta sababuji COVID-19, aynolji kanduɗum lati aynollji injiiniya'en, tokkiti be aynol kugal, e ha ragare man kuje sudugo.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Aynolji injiiniya larni wattugo huwooɓe ha seera be sababuji je larni kugal bila larugo gikku huwoowo, e footi wona dabare je ɓuri naffugo.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Aynolji kugal lati saanjolji nder siyasa kugal mala laahalji je yiɗi hakkilo huwoowo mala jagorɗo.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Kujeji fadol ɓaandu (PPE) lati bana maray sembe do aynolji injiiniya'en be kugal, amma footi naffa ngam aynugo ha wakkere feere.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Kala PPE fu sey suɓɓa ndu do sababu ha huwoowo, je ɗon larti kanduɗum (bana ordoji fuffugo), ɗon ɓorni be lawol e tumtum, lartama, laɓɓi, e saanja to wodi naffuda be wakati, itta be lawol, lalla, siga mala sakkina ngam tato raɓɓa.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Ha U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), kuɗe je wala sappinolji jur maray ngidol jur be ummatore mala be huwooɓe feere.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Dabareji aynol nyau je aranool je feelama ha wakkere kugal fu larni lallugo juɗe boɗɗum e ha wakati fu, sembintinugo huwooɓe ngam wondugo ha saare to ɓe ɗon nyauɗo, laɓɓinugo lawol pofɗe gal suddugo sondaru be ɓislol, hokkugo leepolji be tassawo sakkinugo cuddi, taskugo ngam saanjol baabe jonde mala eggol to wodi haaje man, mbarugo jokke ha huwooɓe tato ɓe huwida be kuje mala ordo yimɓe feere, be laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo wakkere kugal.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Maandugo law e wattugo ha seera yimɓe je bana mari nyau lati yaɓɓorde kanduɗum nder fadol huwooɓe, soddooɓe, ngilloɓe, be feere'en ha wakkere kugal.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Ɗowirɗe Aynol e Lartol Jam Ɓaandu (CDC) Lesɗe America ɗon feela yo'o huwooɓe je mari mandolji nyau pofɗe je bana nyaɗay wonda ha saare sey to ɓaandu maɓɓe wullata fahin, mandolji wullol ɓaandu, mala mandolji feere wanngatta fahin ha ɓawo njamdi 24 bila hoosugo lekki ustugo wullol ɓaandu mala mandolji feere, e yo'o  siwtare ngam nyau caɗɗay, hokka jarfuye ha huwooɓe wonda saare ngam suklugo do jeeyaɗo saare maɓɓe je ɗon nyauɗo ha saare, e je howooɓe aandi siyasaji ndu.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Ha OSHA, kuɗe je ɗon mari sababuji deydey larni ɓe'en je yiɗi ɓadittol yimɓe nder kosɗe  joowey e go'o (1.8 m) je aandi mala je footi mara nyau COVID-19, amma footi nanga nyau SARS-CoV-2 ngam sallinol ummatore ha tarde wakkere filluji, mala ngam goɗɗo neeɓay je warti jaahangal ha lesdi feere be sallinol COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers' concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Ndu larni huwooɓe je ngidi be ummatore bana jaangirdeji, wakkere kugal je ɗon heewi be yimɓe, be wakkereji sippitolji je kujeji ɗon ruffi ha ton jur. Aynolji injiiniya'en ngam kanjuum be geeɓeji je ɗon mari sababu manga ngam nangugo nyau larni wattugo kujeji laɓɓinugo hendu, ɓesdugo hendu, wattugo keleewolji bana leeda tardugo kuje, e wattugo dammuɗe do moota sippolji. Aynolji kugal je kanjuum be geeɓeji je mari sababuji manga ngam raɓɓugo nyau larni sembintinugo huwooɓe je nyauɗo wonnda ha saare, waylittugo kawtalji je gite nder gite be ngewte gal ordo, wattugo suudu je footi egga ndu, darnugo jaahangalji je wala naffuda ha wakkereji je nyau COVID-19 ɗon ton, wurtinugo jaahargalji ngewte jaaawal be daaldal hokkugo matinolji keese do sababuji be gikku fadol COVID-19, ekkitugo kugal ha huwooɓe je yiɗi ɓornugo limse be kujeji fadol, hokkugo dabareji be wakkere kugal je yardi laɓɓinol, lallugo juɗe, ustugo nastirde soddooɓe be ummatore ha wakkere kugal, e ɓiilugo foto noy lallugo juɗe be dabareji sudol feere ngam COVID-19. Do irin kugal man, huwooɓe je mari sabajuji raɓɓugo je deydey sey ɓorna kujeji fadol bana kuje suddugo juɗe, ngapaleewol, darugal yeeso mala leepol suddugo yeeso, mala goggleji.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Huwooɓe ha nder geeɓe ndu mari haaje ordoji fuffugo.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: To goɗɗo do'i nyau ha nder pireewol, aynolji kanduɗum ngam aynugo huwooɓe be sallooɓe feere larni wattugo nyauɗo ha seera be yimɓe feere, dayugo deydey kosɗe 6, suɓɓugo goɗɗo gooto cakka maɓɓe sukla do nyauɗo ndu, e hokka leepol suddugo yeeso ha nyauɗo mala emmugo nyauɗo ndu sudda hunduko mako be kine mako be leepol to o ɗon sonda mala ɓisla.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Geeɓe Kabin sey ɓorna kuje suddugo juɗe je o sakkina ha ɓawo suklugo do nyauɗo je ɗon waɗa jaahangal ndu mala memmugo illam ɓaandu mala baabe je raɓɓotto, to footi waɗa be kujeji fadol feere to nyauɗo ndu mari wullol ɓaandu, sondaru je timmata mala saɗirma nder pofɗe.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Kujeji suddugo juɗe sey sakkina ha nder buuhu je joggugo irin kujeji ndu, e baabe je ɗon raɓɓi sey laɓɓina ndu e laɓɓa ndu. Ko larni kombeewol hortol kujeji fillu, bana kombeewol jaahangal be kombeewolji feere je roondatta yimɓe, aynolji nyau larni yarɓol jaahangol to goɗɗo man nyauɗo, wondugo ha seera e matinugo yimɓe je suklata do jam ɓaandu to a ɗon matti gul

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Ha woɗɗa, aynol ndu sallan no ha nder suudu je wati ha seera. Ko larni jaangirdeji be wakkere jo'inugo ɓikkon, CDC ɗon feela maɓɓolji ha nder wakati seeɗa ngam laɓɓugo mala laɓɓinugo to goɗɗo je mari nyau wondi no ha suudu jaangirde bila larugo sankittol cakka ummatore.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: To wodi sallinol seeɗa ha deydey ummatore, dabare dayugo ummatore footi naffa bana darnugo jaahangal ngilli, mofturdeji, be hawtirdeji maungel bana waɗugo espor, yimmugo mala nyammugo ha ccuɗi nyamɗe, ɓesdugo baabe ha cakka koroomje, ustugo wakati yottugo be dillugo, haɗɗugo ngilli je walla naffuda, hoosugo suudu jam ɓaandu ɓikkon je feere ɓe'en je bana mari mandolji ndamba.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: To wodi sallinol arandere ha nder ummatore wakkere, ha ɓawo dabareji dayugo ummatore, wakati maɓɓolji jaangirde footi ɓesdama. Ko larni yimɓe umrore je ɗon ayna do ko ɗon salla ko wetti fu, sababu jam ɓaandu je law hoccama gal CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Yimɓe umrore ngidan be yimɓe je ɗon mari mala je footi mara nyau COVID-19 feelama ngam tokkugo tawretaji je huwooɓe jam ɓaandu ɗon tokka, bana ɓornugo kujeji fadol.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: To waɗi ɓe hawti ha wakati nangol ngu, huwooɓe sey laɓɓa e laɓɓina kanda maɓɓe je kugal be kujeji maɓɓe hiddeko huwugo ba man fahin sey fuffa kuje lallugo saare mala sufta, e tokka laahalji kugal je ɗon aandin ko larni siggugo be sakkinugo PPE e je joggotto mala lottugo limse.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: OSHA ɗon hocca huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu  be huwooɓe do mayɓe bana ɗon nde geeɓe je sababuji mauni mala mauni masitin.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kuɗe je sababuji lati maungel larni huwooɓe suklare do jam ɓaandu, wallende, suudu lartol, be hortol jam ɓandu je wondi be nyauɓe je mari mala je footi mara COVID-19.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Latan sababu je mauni masin to huwooɓe huwi be laahal fuffugo aerosol do, mala moftugo mala memmugo leekuji ha, yimɓe je ɗon aandi mala footi mara nyau COVID-19.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Laahalji fuufugo aerosol larni sallinugo kuje gal daande, laahalji umminugo sondaru, bronchoscopiji, jaahargal e lartol ni'e feere, mala mofturde leeku.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Kuɗe sababu huwooɓe do mayɓe larni taskugo wade yimɓe je aandi mari mala footi mari nyau COVID-19 ha wakati mayde maɓɓe; ndu lati bana sababu maungel masitin to ɓe ɗon seeka wade ngam larugo ko mbari mo. Aynolji injiiniya'en ɓesdotto ha iirin geeɓe sababu ndu bana cuuɗi wondugo seera nyauɓe je aandi don mari mala je footi mara nyau COVID-19, bana to laahalji fuffugo aerosol ɗon larni.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
targetString: Fuffugo hendu je feerejo footi naffa ha wakkereji jam ɓaandu feere be suklugo do wade.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: Leekuji sey memmotto be dabareji hakkika Biosafety Level 3.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: Geeɓe Jam Ɓaandu Duniyaru (WHO) ɗon feela yo'o nyauɓe je ɗon nasta sey wonda feere be feere ha nder wakkereji ndeenugo to ɓe footi mara nyau COVID-19. Ha ɓesdugo do PPE, OSHA ɗon feela ordoji fuffugo ha yimɓe je ɗon huwa nder kosɗe 6 nyauɓe je ɗon aandi mari, mala je tammi marugo SARS-CoV-2, be ɓe'en je ɗon ngaɗa laahalji fuffugo aerosol.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: Ha Lesɗe America, leepol fuffugo N95 je NIOSH jaɓɓi mala je ɓuri sey huwa be majuum ha nder jaahargal fadol pofɗe fu, je ɗon windi bana lartol wawande, ekkitol, be lartolji nyau.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: Ordoji fuffugo feere footi hokka fadol je ɓuri e saklata huwoowo. WHO feelata limse je ɗon sudda ɓaandu fu ngam COVID-19 woni nyau pofɗe do nummol bana ɗon salla gal illam ɓaandu.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: WHO ɗon feela leepol suudugo yeeso seekowo ha huwooɓe nastirde suudu lekki.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: Ko larni yimɓe je moftatta leekuji pofɗe ha, suklatta do, mala roondatta nyau

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
targetString: To laahal fuffugo aerosol huwidotto, leepol suddugo yeeso seekowo waylittama be ordo N95 mala FFP2.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: Ngam tagle PPE ha nder duniyaru he'ay, WHO ɗon feela ustol haaje PPE gal lartol dayindi, keleewolji bana dammuɗe be darugal, je hokkatta jarfuye nastirde sna ha sukloɓe do nyauɓe COVID-19, huwidugo be PPE sna to kugal man ɗon, huwida be ordo je on ɗon mari bila ittugo ndu ha yakke suklugo do nyauɓe feere-feere je ɗon mari irin lartol ndu, aynugo e fadugo soddooɓe PPE, haɗɗugo

sourceString: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
targetString: DIGA: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO

sourceString: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
targetString: HA : Geeɓe Wikimedia Foundation fu

sourceString: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
targetString: HOORE NGEWTE: [Covid-19] Ustugo nyau be taskugo jaango

sourceString: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
targetString: WAKATI/WAKKERE NELDOL: 14 Maars, 2020, 00:24 UTC

sourceString: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
targetString: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
targetString: Min tawi hoore amin ha nder larulaji maungel lewru ndu.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
targetString: Nyau COVID-19 lati kuje feere ɗon laɓɓina yo'o jonde amin ɓi'i adama sey joɗɗida oya be oya ngam en ɗon larni fu ngam ko ɗon salla jonta ndu.

sourceString: We don't have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
targetString: Min wala kujeji sappinol do man, amma min aandi yo'o jabbuye amin je kanduɗum joɗɗi do jurminol uya be oya, huwidol, be kugal nder ummatore je woni cakkare jonde ndu.

sourceString: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
targetString: Sobiraaku be suklare do ummatore je en lari ha kunde derɗiraaɓe amin gal emailji, ewnolji, be ngewte lati kugal kanduɗum je ɓi'i adama mari sa'a masin je en huwida be man.

sourceString: I couldn't be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
targetString: Footay mi yetta mon e seeya do moɗon ɓuri ɗo ngam limmugo do moɗon derɗiraaɓe.

sourceString: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
targetString: Ha asawere je sallingo, goɗɗo feere sendi be am sembintinugo kugal amin.

sourceString: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
targetString: O siftorini yam noy lati kanduɗum ha duniyaru ngam waylittugo gal Wikipedia jonta ndu, e lati mandol sembe ngam dabare ndu wona do hawo e ko moy fu footi heɓɓa ɗum.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: Kugal moɗon ɗon ngaɗa ɗum footi salla, ko to gal aynugo siteji wonda finditti mala derɗiraaɓe yoɓɓi mala ummatoji jam.

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: Duniyaru mari haaje matinolji je Wikipedia ɗon hokka, jonta ɓuri je sallingo.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: Ndu lati wakati ja na ko en waɗatta tan, amma noy en ɗon ngaɗa ɗum, waɗan feeretirol do duniyaru.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: Ngam daraja kugal ndu be ko on waɗatta ha nder man, en laritan dabareji amin do noy huwidugo, fuɗɗam ha asawere je warata.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Lartolji do kugal amin be jaahargalji

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Bana Robyn matini seeɗa, c-team hawti kenya ngam ngewtidugo dabare be jaahargal amin je balɗe be lebbi je warango.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we're facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Ha nder ngewte ndu, en hoosi ko en tammi wonan jabbol je kanduɗum do ko en ɗon lara jonta be dabare je ɓuri naffugo ngam yahde ummatore ha wakati ndu.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Be seeyo fahin, min yiɗi ittugo tampere e fada kugal amin ngam ha abada.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that's okay.
targetString: To on yiɗi lorugo, bismila.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Ha geeɓe fu, hokkowo kugal, be huwooɓe:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: kugal amin je en footi waɗa ko wetti fu ɗon gal njamɗe 4 nder balɗe, mala njamɗe 20 nder asawere ha matinol feere.

sourceString: We're not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: En matinay siwtare, to on footi huwa ha gaɗɗa njamɗe je ɗon aandi, kugal footi huwida be mon.

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: Amma, ha nder duniyaru je jonta ndu, footay goɗɗo famma ko footi yotta jaango, e to a yiɗi suklugo do ngiɗaɗo maɗa, sodda kujeji, mala yaha ha lekkitajo, jam ɓandu moɗon lati kugal amin.

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: En emmatta ko on waɗi be wakati moɗon.

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: To a nyauɗo, ta huwu.

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we're saying it.
targetString: En maray no haaje yeccugo ɗum, amma en ɗon yecca ɗum.

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: Wala balɗe nyau mala PTO je en emmatta, matinu arduɗo ma e wallu geeɓe ma larta jaahargalji ngam fammugo to wakkereji kanduɗum ɗon suddu.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: (To a lartama bana a mari nyau COVID-19, useni matinu Bryau nder T&C Ops ngam heɓɓa walla mon e aanda yo'o a ɗon jam e watta hakkilo ɗowirɗe do ma).

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: Yimɓe je huwatta nder njamdi heɓɓan ceede lewru maɓɓe.

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: En yecci ɗum timmi,, e  ɗon hasdi lartugo hasduji amin ha hokkooɓe kugal amin be derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon huwa nder njamdi.

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: Ko moy fi keɓɓan ceede lewru mako bana ko o ɗon no jaɓɓa ha wakati je wala jiɓɓol.

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: Ko to a nyauɗo e footay a huwa.

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: To a yiɗi huwugo, min wallan ma.

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: Yimɓe jur ɗon hoosa kugal bana dabare willugo nummolji maɓɓe nder duniyaru je jonta ndu.

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: Ko en ɗon waɗa ndu footi yoɓɓa be sembe, ɓurna be irin wakati bana je jonta.

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: Fahin, ndu larni suklugo do ma be hoore maɗa.

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: Ewnandu amin lati yo'o on ngewta arduɗo moɗon , ngam heɓɓa ko en footi ndena e footi larta nder jaahargal amin.

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: Kugal feere lati bana kanduɗum.

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: Wodi kujeji feere je sey tokkita waɗugo ɗum.

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, be geeɓeji Hoosugo wallende (ha cakka feere'en) ɗon waɗa kugal kanduɗum je footi mara haaje wallende feere.

sourceString: We'll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what's essential for our mission.
targetString: Min fuɗɗan laahal feere be geeɓeji fu ngam lartugo dabareji amin je jonta e woylitta kugal amin do ko ɓuri kanduɗum ngamm kugal amin.

sourceString: There's plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: Wodi kugal jur ngam ko moy fu, en suɓɓan kuɗe je ɓuri naffuda tawon.

sourceString: Slowing now won't hurt later.
targetString: Ɗaayugo jonta nawnata jaango.

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: En tammay "ɓesdugo mon wakati nde ɗiɗi ngam jokkitugo" ha ɓawo nyau duniyaru ndu salli.

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: On footay emmotto ngam ɓesdugo njamɗe feere ngam jokkittugo ko en waɗay jonta.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: Min aandi yo'o kujeji saanji, e en huwidan ngam lartugo dabareji amin be jaahargalji ha wakkere je naffan.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: Ko ɗon salla be APP (Jaahargal Hittande)?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: Ngam lartugo kugal amin jonta be njamɗe ko en footi huwa ha nder balɗe, min yiɗi lartugo wakati wurtinol Jaahargal Hittande amin 2020-2021.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: Ha nummol amin en yiɗi no juttinugo jaahargal 2019-2020 je ɗon hokka wakati jur ngam suɓɓugo ceede ngam hokkugo jarfuye ha huwooɓe lara kugal kanduɗum, suklugo do hoore maɓɓe, be suklare do ngiɗaɓe maɓɓe ha wakati man en hoosan ɓe'en je yiɗi nastugo mala je yiɗi ustugo jaahargal maɓɓe ha nder asaweji je warango.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: Juttinol wakati ndu ustan be ɗuɗɗum jaahargal kuɗe be jaawal ha nder ummatore man fu.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: En sappinan ko en hasdi ha Arduɗo ha asawere je warango e matinan fadooɓe be geeɓeji ha yaɓɓorde je warango to en heɓɓi jabbol ni.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: Min yetti geeɓe APP ngam fadol moɗon.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: Wondugo ɗowirɗe, sappinol be laɓɓinol

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Ha asawere je sallingo, e ekkiti yo'o gooto cakka derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon woni ha SF, hoore mako ɗon no sappini ha viriis COVID-19.

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: Amma, do hakkikaji amin fu, en hoosi geeɓe je suklatta do laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo baabe fu je mari viriis ha ɗowirɗe San Francisco.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: Geeɓe ndu huwidi be dabare je mbardugo viriisji je suudu lekki fu ɗon huwida be man ngam laɓɓinugo baabe, be nastirde, be kuje hortol ha do suudu feere.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: Mahdi ndu ɗon huwida be dabare laɓɓinol maɗa e ɗon huwida be kujeji je ɗon fada jam wonɗɓe.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: Min ɗon seeyi ngam baabal kugal wonan taskuɗum do ndey en loratta.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: Baabal kugal amin je DC ha nder WeWork, je sendi dabare COVID-19 maɗa be amin be jeeyaɗo geeɓe DC.

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: Ha asawere je sallingo, suudu kugal amin je DC eggi ha wakkere je ɗon dayi masin je ɗon ɗowtina dabare je sendama be San Francisco.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: Bana derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon woni ha NYC, min ngewtidi bo'o do hoosugo suudu feere ha Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: Ngewteji ndu ɗon tokkita amma footi ɗaaya.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: Derɗiraaɓe amin feere ɗon huwida diga dayindi nde arandere wakati.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: Derɗiraaɓe amin je je wawi huwidugo diga dayindi aandi yo'o footi wona lartol, e yiɗi hokkugo mon feeloji feere:

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: Usta juttol kawtirolji ha ɗuɗɗum man njamdi gooto mala ɗiɗi.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: To wodi haaje kawtirolji je ɓuri juttugo, lare noy en footi ta'a ɗum nder jur do balɗe jur.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: Hokke uja kawtal ndu, ko en ngewtataa do man, e nelde kujeji jaangugo be wakati

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: Ngaɗe vidiyoji ragare man, be kujeji bana Google Docs be Zoom ngam latinugo huwidol be kawtirde kooyɗum.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: Keeɓe ɗowuwo ngam kaja kawtal, goɗɗo je footi fada ngewte ngam emmolji e larta limtol mo je hoccata wolde, be goɗɗo ngam wallugo windugo ko je ɗon limti (mala huwida be windugo).

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: Neldu email ha wallende teknik to a mari haaji kuje heeɗitugo je boɗɗe.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: Hoose lorni jam woore mon ngam nyamɗe.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: Jokke #remoties channel nder Slack ngam wolwugo be derɗiraaɓe moɗon do kugal je sedama

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: Geeɓe Kuɗe HR ɗon lara nder dabareji sappinol nder webinar ngam wallugo be kugal je ɗon sendi ha nder Foundation.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: Ha nder asawere je sallingo en emmi jaɓɓoɓe ummatore fu willa kujeji ummatore je Wikimedia on hokki ceede, bana editathons, ha wakati to WHO matini yo'o nyau duniyaru ndu.

sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: Min matiniɓe yo'o en fammi emmol amin do willolji be darnolji footi artira ɗum footay timmina kuɗe maɓɓe je ɓe hasdi do man e footay ɓe elta goɗɗo ngam o ɗaayini mala saanji ɗm.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: Ha nder asawere je warango en tamman tokkitugo be sappinol Wikimania be kawtiroolji be ngewte ummatore wakkere feere.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: Tammunde yimɓe fu ha nder ummatore lesdi fu woni bana nyurmende ngam darnol amma seeyo ngam laɓɓinol be wawande do ummatoji maɓɓe, Wikimedia be feere.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: Tokkitugo, CRT ɗon huwa ngam wanginugo batakkewol do Meta-Wiki ngam hokkugo daaldal ha ummatore ngam fadugo sembe man e tokkitugo ngewte amin be maɓɓe.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: Wondugo do ko larni COVID-19.

sourceString: We'll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: En neldan ewnanduji ha jaahargalji moɗon Alaamisa je warango, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT ngam kawtal geeɓe je feerejo.

sourceString: We'll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: En huwidan nder wakati ndu ngam sendugo lartolji feere, jabba do emmolji moɗon e majjina wakati seeɗa ngewtidugo oya be oya.

sourceString: We're in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: Min ɗon ngondi nder man e en taski wallugo ko moy fu.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: Ha wakati feere, footi a tokkita heɓɓugo matinolji ngam email ndu be matinolji feere je kanduɗum je larni COVID-19, do Office Wiki.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: CRT lartan batakeji ndu be matinolji fu ha baabe gooto.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: Min ɗon huwa bo'o ngam ngewteji je tumtum be geeɓe je wondi ha nder lesɗe je ɗon memmi masitin jonta.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don't hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: To wodi emmol ma ɗon do jaahangal, kuɗe, kugal kanduɗum, mala larula ngam jokkitol, mala kuje feere je footi a mara haaje man, useni ta miije ngam matinugo e huwa be CRT.

sourceString: We're here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: Min ɗon wondi ngam wallugo be hawtugo yimɓe to wodi haaje.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: To a wodi ngewte amana mala je ɗon kanduɗum, useni neldine email ha Bryan Judan - Ɗowuwo HR International Global Operations.

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: Wala gooto ha cakka saanjolji ndu wangan bana accugol kugal amin mala kuɗe amin.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: Amma, lati bana aandinol yo'o ha wakati nde, kugal amin be kuɗe amin sey wona lartama bana ko en meɗɗay sam.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: Ndu lati yaɓɓordeji je en tammi naffan nder wallugo oya be oya ngam heɓɓa tokkitugo huwugo, waallugo yahde amin be ko a mari haaje, be duniyaru fu be kuɗe je ɓe ɗn ndeni.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: Kuɗe amin je en waɗi jaahargal wondan nder reenugo amin ha wakati man yotta.

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: Jonta, lati wakati wallugo oya be oya e heɓɓa daaldal ngam kugal kanduɗum je waratta ha nder asaweji e temma nder leeɓi je warango.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: Min mari haaje mon fu ngam heɓɓa kuje man yotta, nden kati min mari haaje mon fu ngam suklugo do moɗon be caalaje mon ngam ha on wona jam ha wakati je en ewnan mon.

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don't touch your face!
targetString: Jonta, useni -- lalle juɗe mon e ta memme yeeso moɗon!

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), be luttuɗum Geeɓe Ardugo (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, be Toby N).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) lati neeɓam je ɗon wondi gal yaasi daaldal (laaral cellji) cellji ha nder fuffu, laabi iyam, ɓernde, ɓooye, be teetekki.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 ɗon haɗɗa kugal ko larni neebam waylittol angiotensin (ACE) gal ustugo yahde angiotensin-II be ɓesdugo Ang(1-7) je ɗon wartira ɗum bana lekki je footi naffa nder hurgol nyauji ɓernde. ACE2 bo'o lati bana dammugal ha nder cellji ha koronaviriisji feere.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Neebam je neɗɗo ɓurna fu ewnotto bana hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Neebam 2 je ɗon waylitta Angiotensin lati metalloenzyme je ɗon mari zinc e ɗon woni ha do endothelial be cellji feere.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: ACE2 protein ɗon mari N-terminal peptidase M2 domain be C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 is lati nastirde woore type I membrane protein, je ɗon mari neebam je ɗon huwa e ɗon woni do cellji ha nder fuffu be kujeji feere.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Domain ACE2 je gal yaasi cell ɗon ta'i be transmembrane domain gal neebam feere je mbiyotto bana sheddase, be proteinji je ɗon ɗiggi ɗon illa nder iyam e ha ragare man wurtan gal ciile.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 ɗon wondi ha ɓurna kujeji ɗaandu: ACE2 ɗon hawti be laaral cell je fuffu je ɓurna cellji type II alveolar, enterocytes teetekki je peetel, ceelji arterial be venous endothelial be cellji arterial smooth muscle ha ɓurna kujeji ɓaandu.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: Jaangirde ACE2 mRNA tawama bo'o ha nder cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, be ɗaaɗon ngaandi.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: Aranool kugal ACE2 lati bana counter balance ha ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE ɗon wartira hormone angiotensin I do vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 kanjuum bo'o ɗon wartira carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine diga angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) do vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 footi bo'o wartira lamba peptidji feere bana [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, be ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 bo'o ɗon mo'ina laaral roondoowo neutral amino acid SLC6A19 e lati bana ɗaaɗol nyau Hartnup.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Bana transmembrane protein, ACE2 lati bana dammugal woore ha nder cellji koronaviriisji feere, bana HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (viriis je wangini COVID-19).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Laɓɓinugo bo'o, hawtirde spike S1 protein je SARS-CoV be SARS-CoV2 ha enzymatic domain ACE2 do cellji latan endocytosis be translocation viriisji ɗiɗi ndu be neebam do endosomeji je ɗon wondi ha nder cellji.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Nastirde ndu yardi fuɗɗorde S protein gal jaɓɓowo serine protease TMPRSS2, je illam man ɗon do teffol bana dabare hurgol. Ndu waɗi en tammi yo'o ustol yahdeji ACE2, ha nder cellji, footi naffa ngam hurgol nyau ndu.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Lartol fu be laritolji ekkitolji fu je wangi ha 11 Zwiiye 2012, tawi yo'o "huwugo be of ACE inhibitors hawti no be ustol 34% sababu pneumonia foondi be aynolji."

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: Fahin bo'o, "sababu pneumonia usti ha nyauɓe je hurgotto be ACE inhibitors je ɗon no mari sababu maungel raɓɓugo pneumonia, ɓurna fu ha ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau illol iyam be semɓe be nyau ɓernde.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: Hoosugo ACE inhibitors hawti bo'o be ustol mayde gal pneumonia, ko to sappinolji lessi do sababu pneumonia fu".

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) woni bana hurgol keese ngam huudure do fuffu je nyaɗay, e bana ɗon hokka sembe ha iyam nder fuffu be hebbinol hendu ha ɓikkon gaduji je ɓe tuffini ɓe gilɗi nyau pofɗe je larni lipopolysaccharide.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Reeta yonki rhACE2 ha neɗɗo woni gal njamɗe 10 e fuɗɗam kugal lati minti 30 be ɓedugo ha yahde sababu (wakati) ha nder njamɗe 24.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Sappinolji jur ɗon feela yo'o rhACE2 footi wona lekki kanduɗum ha yimɓe je footay jaɓɓa classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) mala ha nyauji je angiotensin II ɗon wa'i. rhACE2 je ɓe tuffi lartama ha nder lartolji suudu lekki ngam hurgol nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: b'COVID-19 apps woni applicasionji je ɓe wurtini ngam wallugo teffugo yimɓe bana jabbuye do nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, bana wi'ugo laahal maandugo yimɓe ("ngidooɓe") je footi wondi no be goɗɗo je ɗon mari nyau.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: Applikasionji jur wangi mala ɗon feeli, be wallende ngomna be hoore mako ha nder wakkareji be lamordeji feere.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Sappinolji dabare wanginugo applikasionji tawtol wurtama.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Larulaji ngam amana wangi no'o, ɓurna fu do dabareji je ɗon wondi do tawtugo wakkere jonde yimɓe je ɗon huwa be applikasionji ndu.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Dabareji je lessi sappinugo matinolji do goɗɗo ɗon huwa be mandolji Bluetooth ngam hoosugo ɓadol be telefonji feere.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Ha 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple matini ha wakati gootel yo'o ɓe nastinan kujeji ngam mballugo irin applikasionji be Bluetooth ha nder dabareji kugal Android be iOS maɓɓe.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: Ha Cayna, ngomna Cayna, hawti be Alipay, wurtini applikasion feere je ɗon hokka jarfuye ha ummatore larta to ɓe ngondi no be yimɓe je mari no COVID-19.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Yimɓe ɗon huwa be man ha nder berniji Cayna 200. Ha Singapore, wodi applikasion je ewnotto TraceTogether.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: Yimɓe IT ummatore on wurtini applikasion man, wangi bana maɓɓiti ha ko moy fu e hokkan ndu ha ngomna. Ha Woila Macedoniya wodi applikasion feere je ɗon huwa be Bluetoth je ewnotto "StopKorona!", ngam sappinugo sababuji je temma on wondi be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau e hokka jabbuye law ha arduɓe jam ɓaandu.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: Applikasion wangi gal kugal Geeɓeji Ngewte be Teknik be Jam Ɓaandu.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Ha 14 Aviiril 2020, applikasion ndu ɗon no ndeena jaɓɓol Google Play Store be Apple App Store.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Ha 12 Aviiril, ngomna matini yo'o applikasion tawtugo yimɓe ha nder yahde je ɗon nyauɗum, e wondan ngam sendugo ha nder asaweji. Jaahargal irin applikasion ndu ngaɗi timmi ha Ireland, be Faraansa ("StopCovid").

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australia be New Zealand ɗon larta applikasionji je ɗon wondi do aandal applikasion TraceTogether Singapore be dabare BlueTrace. Russiya tammi wanginugo applikasion waɗugo keleewol wakkerereji ngam nyauɓe COVID-19 je wondi ha Moscow, ngam fammugo be fakatre ɓe wala wurtugo saare.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Ross Anderson, jaanginowo security engineering ha Cambridge University, limti no larulaji je kugal je applikasionji footi mara, bana sappinugo goɗɗo bana mari nyau amma wonay gonga, e fottay wonda kanduɗum to ɗon larni ummatore seeɗa tan.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: Be lintugo larulaji ngam wangolji waagare applikasionji "koronaviriis" je wonay gonga mala kalluɗum, Apple sappini keerolji je geeɓeji footi ɓesda applikasionji je larni koronaviriis ha App Store maɗa, haɗɗugo ndu ha "ngomna" mala geeɓeji je ɗon aandi.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Google be Amazon waɗi irin keleewolji ndu timmi.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Yimɓe je ɗon no sikka ngam larula je larni amana holli larula maɓɓe do ko larni aynol yimɓe fu gal applikasionji koronaviriis, ɓurna fu do to dabare aynol je ɓe wangini ngam darnugo nyau koronaviriis darnotto to nyau man salli.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Amnesty International be ɓuri geeɓeji 100 feere wurtini haala feere gal ewnugo do keleewolji do irin aynolji ndu.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Geeɓeji ndu matini larulaji do kuɗe ngomna:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: aynol footi wona no "kanduɗum, mari naffuda be kalkal";

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: juttinol llartol be aynol maran no umroji do darnol;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: kugal be matinolji haɗɗan no do dabareji ngam COVID-19.

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: jam matinolji be bila windol inde wonan no siggotto e wona bana ɗon fadi do sappinolji;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: aynol matinolji darnan no lasɓinol be gaanyu je ɗon ɓesda ndu;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: kala sendol matinolji be goɗɗo feere sey umrore hasda do ndu;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: dabareji keerolji wonan ngam huddi be jarfuji ummatore ngam jabbinugo do huddi;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: wondugo yimɓe fu nder dabare ndu gal "jagorɓe kanduɗum" sey emmotto, bana je wawooɓe jam ɓaandu be geeɓe je lasbinama. German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) be Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) wurtini bo'o dabareji.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: Jaahargal Google/Apple yiɗi larugo nder haala aynol je ɗon tokkiti ndu gal ittugo dabare sappinol wakkere je goɗɗo ɗon wondi ha ton nder ordoji maɓɓe ha ɓawo to wala naffuda fahin.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: Lesɗe feere ɗon no huwida be ordo aynol amma na be applikasionji, ko ɗon waɗa bila wattugo applikasion feere be dabare je wala goɗɗo tokka ma gal ɓawo.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: Ha Israayila, dabare aynol be ordo jaɓɓama.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: Dabareji je wondi gal aynol wakkere wonde ɗon footi mara larulaji be matinolji amana yimɓe.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
targetString: Amma, na kala dabareji fu be ordoji cakkare mari haaje nastugo nder matinolji do wonde moɗon; wodi dabareji siggorde matinolji ngurtama je ɗon salla gal ordoji cakkare ngam saanjol ngewte (lare geeɓe je les).

sourceString: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
targetString: Ha South Korea, wodi dabare je wonday do applikasion naffi ngam lartugo ngidol.

sourceString: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
targetString: Ha do huwugo be applikasion je ɗon hokki, ordo ndu mofti matinoljin laritol ndu gal dabare feere-feere bana matinolji wonde telefon be matinolji karte ceede, e hawti ɓe fu ngam wurtinugo batakkeji gal bindi ha yimɓe je footi mara nyau.

sourceString: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
targetString: Ha ɓesdugo huwugo be matinolji sappinugo baabal wonde , ngomna wurtini matinolji wondugo maɓɓittama ha ummatore fu, ko ɗon jarfi ngam saanjolji feere be umroji do matinolji ha ɓawo nyau MERS ha lesdi ndu.

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
targetString: Matinolji ndu ɗon maɓɓitti ha ummatore gal limgal applikasionji be wedji. Lesɗe bana Jaamani hasdi ngam hawtugo dabareji joggugo matinolji be je cakkare.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
targetString: Ha 6 Aviiril 2020, matinolji man ngurtay no tawon.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Laritol wakkere wonde be matinolji je siggotto ɗon aandi, be ekkitoji teffooɓe je ɗon lora pettum man 2013. Ha 7 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri wawooɓe sappo e ɗiɗi huwidi no do dabareji siggorde matiolji, bana huwugo be Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) ngam teffugo huwoowo be telefonji feere.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: Amma, PEPP-PT woni sembe je hawtama je wodi dabareji ɗiɗi fu je cakkare be je sankittito, e wonay dabare woore. Dabareji je ɗon sankittito larni  Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) be feere.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
targetString: Ha nder dabareji ndu, matinolji je footi heɓta footay wurta ordo, e hawtirde fu don salla do ordo ndu.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Privacy Group ha MIT Media Lab ɗon no haɗda do SafePaths, daaldal huwugo be dabareji siggorde maandirɗum ha wakati mofturde matinolji be huwugo be matinolji wakkere be ngidol ngam aynugo sankittol COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Wondi do teffol deftere je wala kuje ha ton "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" je wurti ha Maars 2020. Wodi irin dabare ndu je woni daaldal SafeTrace gal Enigma MPC, geeɓe feere je ɗon huwa do wurtinugo dabareji aandol je tawama bo'o ha MIT Media Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: SafeTrace ɗon huwa be dabareji teknik je jam jarfugo huwooɓe senda matinolji do wakkere be jam ɓaandu be yimɓe feere be ymɓe ngomna, bila hallinugo matinolji maandirɗum

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Ha  5 Aviiril 2020, TCN Coalition fu wangi gal geeɓeji je hawti ha ɓawo ko lati bana mari irin dabare man be irin yaɓɓordeji ndu, je hasdi ngam ustugo ta'irdeji, e waɗa yo'o aynol sankittol nyau ndu salla gal applikasionji je footi ha keerolji duniyaru fu.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Ha 9 Aviiril 2020, ngomna Singapore matini yo'o o wangini dabare BlueTrace ha yeeso ummatore fu gal applikasion je hokki ha ngomna maɗa.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Ha 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple, geeɓeji mauɓe je ɗon mari daaldal telefon Android be iOS, matini dabare feere ngam laritol ngidol, je ɓe tammi siggan maadirɗum yimɓe, gal dabarehawtirde Bluetooth Low Energy technology be bindi je ɗon sigga matinolji maandirɗum.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Fahin bo'o ɓe wurtini cakkare dabareji je woni ha nder ordo ndu.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Ha limtol Apple be Google, ordo ndu wurtan nder yaɓɓordeji tati:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: wurtinol kujeji ngam heɓɓa ngomna wangina applikasionji aynol sankittol koronaviriis je ngomna e je ɗon sigga mandirɗum.

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: nastinugo kuɗe maɗa ha nder jaahargal iOS be AndroidGoogle be Apple ngam heɓɓugo jabbuji ha do jaɓɓol be larulaji aynol gal sendugo ha aranool man tawon dabare mal gal lartollji huwugo ordoji ndu, e ha ɓawo man ittugo ndu bana ha fuɗɗam to nyau man salli timmi.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: Lortirugo b'Drug (je ɗon aandin bana laritugo lekki fahin, re-profiling, re-tasking mala saanjugo hurgol) woni laritugo hasduye aranool do lekki je ɗon jarfi timmi ngam hurgol nyau feere mala mandoji nyau feere je ngaɗotto do man aran.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Nda teffol aandal nder wolde gooto je ɗon tokkiti ngam wurtinugo lekki je ɗon jam e ɗon naffa ngam hurgugo nyau COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Dabareji teffol feere larni wanginol baatal be plasma COVID-19. SARS-CoV ɗon mari proteinji 66 je footi hawta be lekki, kala fu ɗon mari baabe hawtirugo jur.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Lartugo baabe hawtirdeji ndu kuɗe kanduɗum nde do wurtinugo lekki mbardugo viriis je ɗon naffa ngam proteinji COVID-19.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Ha kunde proteinji SARS-CoV-2 je ɓuri woɗɗugo wondi protease je ɗon naandi papain, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, be ADP ribophosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein AA, et al. jaangi hawtirdeji lekki foondol je o hoosi e larti naandol suudu ha ɓawo man, e sappini naandolji jur be lekki je jarfotto ngam yaawinugo ko footi wona lekki kanduɗum je mbardatta SARS-CoV-2 ha nder ekkitol mako je hiddeko ngam feelugo ha nder dabare ekkitol ha suudu lekki.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: Chloroquine woni lekki paaɓooje je ɗon feeli ngam nyauji feere bo'o.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Ha 18 Maars, WHO matini yo'o chloroquine be hydroxychloroquine footi wona ha cakka lekki je don nder ekkitol foondol ha suudu lekki Solidarity.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: Ngomna New York Andrew Cuomo matini yo'o foondolji New York State do chloroquine be hydroxychloroquine footi fuɗɗa ha 24 Maars. Ha 28 Maars, FDA jarfi hoccol hydroxychloroquine sulfate be chloroquine phosphate to wodi jaawal Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: Laahal foondolji ha suudu lekki FDA jarfay hurgol ngol tawon e ɗon jarfi sna be hasduye EUA bana hurgol foondol tan to wodi jaawal be hurgol ha nyauɓe je wondi ha suudu lekki amma je footay keɓɓa hurgol ha lartol suudu lekki.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: CDC wi'i yo'o "hoosugo, hokkugo, mala neeɓugo hydroxychloroquine ngam prophylaxis mmala hurgol nyau SARS-CoV-2" jarfakke tawon.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Lekkitoɓe wi'i yo'o ɓe ɗon hokka lekki man to "wala dabare feere".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Geeɓe teffol Turkia'en feere ha Istanbul ɗon sallina ekkitol feere do chloroquine be zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C be vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Ekkitolji feere maungel ɗon do lawol ha Duke University be University of Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: NYU Langone Medical School ɗon waɗa foondol do jam e naffuda hoosugo hydroxychloroquine bana dabare aynol.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Foondolji ha suudu lekki Cayna ha Wuhan be Shenzhen wi'i yo'o favipiravir ɗon "naffa masin".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Nyauɓe 35 ha Shenzhen larti bana maray nyau ha nder balɗe 4, e juttol nyau man bo'o balɗe 11 ha cakka nyauɓe 45 je hoosay ɗum.
